New Records: Amen Thompson added 23 points and a career-high 16 rebounds
Key Match Events: Fred VanVleet grabbed a key steal late to allow the Houston Rockets to hold on for a 119-115 win over the Los Angeles Lakers
A basket by LeBron James got the Lakers within 117-115 with eight seconds to go
Alperen Sengun missed 1 of 2 free throws after that to give Los Angeles a chance to tie it
But VanVleet stole the inbounds pass intended for James. VanVleet made 1 of 2 free throws to secure the victory
Pre-Game Insights: The second-year player Amen Thompson is starting in place of Jabari Smith Jr., who could be out up to two months after breaking a bone in his hand Friday
Post-Match Reflections: Jalen Green was a spark for the HOU offense in their W to stay in 2nd in the West!
But VanVleet stole the inbounds pass intended for James. VanVleet made 1 of 2 free throws to secure the victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets remained up by seven about a minute after that when a 3 by Davis cut the lead to 117-113 before the basket by James
Los Angeles used an 11-2 run, with six points from Davis, to get within two with 4 minutes to go
A dunk by Thompson started a 7-2 run that pushed Houston’s lead to 115-108 with 2 ½ minutes remaining
The Rockets had 52 points in the paint to 40 by the Lakers
Others: Anthony Davis had 30 points and 13 rebounds for the Lakers. James added 21 points, 13 rebounds and nine assists
